snippet: The biotechnology giant Amgen, seeking to bolster its drug discovery efforts, said it would pay $415 million in cash to acquire deCODE Genetics, a gene-hunting firm based in Iceland.
abstract: The biotechnology giant Amgen, seeking to bolster its drug discovery efforts, said it would pay $415 million in cash to acquire deCODE Genetics, a gene-hunting firm based in Iceland.

headline.main: Amgen to Acquire the Gene-Hunting Firm deCODE
headline.print_headline: Amgen to Buy Firm Working On Gene Links To Diseases
